original: Asplund, Uno Mauritz, redaktör, Göteborg, f. 6/1/10 i Gbg av med. dr Mauritz A. o. h. h. f. Morales. G. 37 m. Arija Supkiewicz. Barn: Rolf f. 44. — Stud:ex. 30, stud. v. Gbgs högsk. 30-32, stud. i Engl. 32. Res. t. Engl. 33, 34, 35 o. 37 samt t. Frankr. 34, 35 o. 37. Sportjournalist i Morgontidn. i Gbg 32-41, redig, film-, teater- o. radiospalten i Gbgs Handels- o. Sjö-farts-Tidn. sed. 45. Intend. i Gbgs filmsällsk. sed. 44, ordensskald i TSO. Skr.: Världsstjärnor — och svenska — igenom tiderna (45). Har även komp. o. fått ut i tryck o. på grammofon en dei musik samt skrivit texter f. bl. a. Karl Gerhards’ revyer. Sign.: Big Ben. Hobby: vissling. (Har upptr. i sv. radio uppr. ggr samit även på uti. scen). Inneh. flera DM-tecken i fri idr. (Har not. inoff. ’sv. rekord i trestegshopp u. ansats 9.67 m.).
translated: Asplund, Uno Mauritz, editor, Gothenburg, born on January 6, 1910 in Gothenburg, to Dr. Mauritz A. and his wife H.H.F. Morales. Married in 1937 to Arija Supkiewicz. Children: Rolf (born in 1944). He completed his high school studies in 1930, studied at Gothenburg University from 1930 to 1932, and studied in England in 1932. He traveled to England in 1933, 1934, 1935, and 1937, as well as to France in 1934, 1935, and 1937. He worked as a sports journalist in the "Morgontidn." newspaper in Gothenburg from 1932 to 1941, and as an editor of film, theater and radio column in "Gothenburg Trade and Maritime News" since 1945. He was an intendant in Gothenburg's film society since 1944, an order poet in the Society for the Promotion of Culture since 1945. He has written "World Stars - and Swedish - Throughout the Ages" (1945) and has also composed and printed his own music, which has been recorded on a gramophone. He has written texts for Karl Gerhard's revues. He uses the pseudonym Big Ben and has a hobby of whistling. He has performed several times on Swedish radio and also on international stages. He has won several awards in competitive sports and has an unofficial Swedish record in triple jump without a run-up, measured at 9.67m.

structured.description: Uno Mauritz Asplund was a Swedish editor and sports journalist.
